intro: Microcasia oblanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf microcasia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are typically yellow with five petals. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
